title: Cyclone Ditwah hits Sri Lanka, floods devastate South-East Asia | ABC NEWS
description: Severe floods have struck South-east Asia, impacting millions in Indonesia, Malaysia, and Thailand. Across Asia, Cyclone Ditwah has brought heavy rain to Sri Lanka, prompting residents to seek refuge on their roofs as floodwaters rise. Authorities warn of more rain in the central and northern regions. title: Several Jetstar flights grounded after Airbus A320 recall | ABC NEWS
description: Jetstar has grounded several flights due to a global recall of Airbus A320 aircraft. Repairs for about two-thirds of the affected planes will be quick as airlines revert to earlier software, but some may remain grounded longer for hardware changes. Jetstar has not specified how many of its 56 A320s are impacted, but some flights cannot depart. title: Estella brings strength and resilience as she navigates life with disability in remote NT | ABC NEWS
description: For this year's International Day of People Living with Disability, we visit the outback town of Tennant Creek in the Northern Territory, which is home to Amy James and Estella Jones. Both young women live with disability. As our guest reporter, Amy interviews her friend Estella and her Mum, on growing up in the Barkly Region. By Dianne King for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Consumers paying more for 'mineral' sunscreen similar to generic types, study finds | ABC NEWS
description: Researchers at the University of New South Wales found that Australians are paying more for "mineral" sunscreens, perceived as more "natural" and "gentle," even though they are nearly identical to cheaper generic brands. Chemistry professor Jon Beves calls for greater transparency from sunscreen brands regarding their active ingredients. title: Airport chaos around the country as Jetstar grounds Airbus A320s | ABC NEWS
description: Thousands of Jetstar passengers across Australia have been affected by a global issue that has seen Airbus A320 planes around the world grounded.  Passengers flying with Jetstar have been told to expect major delays, and a number of flights were cancelled.  Jetstar has 86 of the A320 aircraft in its fleet of which 34 are affected by the software issue, while Qantas also uses the planes but said its services were not affected.  The flight disruptions in Australia were affecting all major domestic airports on Saturday morning, with multiple flight cancellations at all airports handling Jetstar flights. title: Ambulance Victoria drops 'no beards' requirement for paramedics | ABC NEWS
description: A student paramedic successfully challenged Ambulance Victoria's requirement that all ambulance workers be clean-shaven for mask fitting purposes.   19-year-old Prabhjeet Gill, who is Sikh, filed a complaint with the Australian Human Rights Commission, arguing that Ambulance Victoria's refusal to let him undertake a mask fitting without shaving first was discriminating on cultural and religious grounds.  The Singh Thattha mask fitting method involves covering the beard with an elastic band underneath the mask, and has been adopted in other jurisdictions to achieve a safe mask fitting.   Original reporting by Sacha Payne.  Social version by Madeleine Wales for the ABC News Social Media Team.
